Asthma, rhinitis |Rank=A |Title=Knowing the objectives and monitoring methods of first-line disease-modifying asthma treatment. |Description=None |Section=Management |Contributors= |Order=19}} The aim of background asthma treatment is to achieve asthma control as described above (see asthma control). In addition to monitoring efficacy, treatment monitoring includes: o Assessing compliance with treatment o Systematic assessment of the grip technique o Looking for side effects (oral mycosis)

question.question: Which of the following is NOT a component of monitoring first-line disease-modifying asthma treatment?
question.option_b: Systematic assessment of the grip technique
question.option_d: Regularly checking lung function with spirometry
